Spectacular game in the franchise! 
The DLC's also tie up to the first Bioshock which is awesome to play.
Fallout 4 - open world - roleplay + story + time and transdimension travel = BioShock Infinite

This is  my favourite game from the trilogy.
The environment is beautiful(I like Columbia more than Rapture).The gameplay was smooth too and although the story has no meaningful choices or multiple endings,its one ending more than make up for it. Get ready for the plot twists that will make you speechless. If you can play the Burial at Sea DLC too.

Overall:10/10
el mejor juego que he jugado recientemente

I mutilated an officer with some meat grappling hook, that launches me to the sky.

Then I went home and played Bioshock: Infinite. 11/10
De forma inesperada me surpreendeu mesmo eu jogando com um p√© atr√°s, recomendo cada centavo jogar a trilogia por completo, principalmente esse pra fechar a hist√≥ria.

Bioshock: Infinite [spoiler] Elizabeths  [/spoiler] more like.

Extremely fun game though. Much more linear and simplistic compared to its predecessors but  way more swift and actiony, more intense in some ways, much more dynamic and such.  

A real breath of fresh air, pun intended, as the new environment, setting, characters really bring a completely different experience, narrative and thus new opportunities and such.

And there's always the Burial At Sea DLC for fans of the classic games too...

Polecam!
Obra-Prima dos games
great story and amazing visuals but the gameplay is a lot worse than the first two
good

console port

aim assist you can't turn off

default aim button is binded to your scroll wheel button.

game won't run with any performance monitoring software. (MSI Afterburner Rivatuner will get you a black screen onstartup with no explanation as to why unless you look it up)

overall, the aim assist makes aiming a chore and unfun, you have to fight it to get headshots, besides that I suppose the game is okay, its definitely not as good as bioshock 2 and if you liked bioshock 2's gameplay a lot, you won't be so familiar with this one.

The "Vigor" controls are unintuitive, I hardly used them and honestly forgot about them until I needed to use them to advance, the game's pacing is significantly more open and dynamic compared to previous games. However this means you can sometimes get lost in a level and things aren't so clear a lot of the time. You won't get the magic arrow on the top of your screen anymore.

The graphics are very impressive for 2013, the Burial at Sea DLC looks like it could have been made in current year despite now being 8 years old. I found myself missing rapture a lot,  Columbia just doesn't feel the same.

This game was my first ever FPS and got me into the entire genre of video games. I wouldn't be playing any of the games I love today if I hadn't given this a try. I can't recommend this game enough. It's not flawless by any means but the combination of fun gameplay, the variety in enemies, the mindbending story, the voice acting and the beautiful graphics are more than enough for me to make this one of my favorite games ever.
A damn good story. Possibly the best. Certainly the way to send off the series and make it legendary. Let us all hope, they never go back to this series, and ruin it.
increible, tiene mucha dificultad porque hay que jugar con una mano debido a que esta elizabeth

I had fun while playing the game. I think it has low replay value. The story is a disjointed mess and doesn't want to commit to any particular idea. None of the characters are particularly likable. Combat became pretty repetitive after a while; I couldn't find a reason to use anything but MOC and the sniper. 

If I wanted to play a shoot-'em-up with secondary regard for the story, I'd choose Borderlands 2 instead. Even then, the story for BL2 is miles better as well.

This is a single-player story driven action-adventure at it's peak.

Initially it just seems like a good fps with some new twists and nothing more but as the story unfolds you'll start to realize that it's more than that,
and yes i'd also agree that the game drags in the middle with stupid video-game objectives (now go there and grab that kinda shit) but please don't quit it there like i did 3-4 years back, just continue playing and you'll witness one of the best video-game storyline ever. 

Basically a game with awesome combat and gameplay system, beautiful graphics that have aged really well and a plot with great twists and a head scratching ending, what more do you want?
It's an experience, Live it.

 "We swim in different oceans, but land on the same shore." - Elizabeth

pese a los a√±os es bastante bueno, y la dificultad maxima que ofrece el juego es una locura. La historia es muy buena y me sorprendio mucho el final, nunca lo habia jugado antes, recomendadicimo.

Je viens de finir le jeu (je l'ai eu un peu en avance).
C'est tout simplement pour moi le meilleur jeu de ce d√©but d'ann√©e et de loin.

Je suis un fan des deux premier opus, et ce 3eme √©pisode me faisait peur a cause de ce nouvel environnement et cette nouvelle ambiance, j'avais peur de perdre l'√¢me des deux pr√©c√©dents.

En effet, c'est moins lugubre, moins effrayant.. Mais l'esprit y reste le m√™me, et je dit bravo aux d√©veloppeurs pour avoir r√©ussi a recr√©√© un chef-d'oeuvre semblable au 1er opus. Car oui, cet √©pisode est une r√©ussite autant sur le gameplay totalement jouissif et fluide, que sur la narration et le sc√©nario de grande qualit√©.

Le fait que Booker parle, r√©agisse a son entourage, facilite l'immersion. On se sent aussi perdu que lui. De plus, le personnage d'Elizabeth est la pour vous donner la r√©plique, vous aider dans vos combat sans vous g√™ner. Elle est pour moi la principale r√©ussite du jeu, il suffit de l'observer de temps en temps : son attitude, ses expressions et son caract√®re la rende √©trangement "humaine", on s'y attache.

Le gameplay est un peu plus orient√© action que les deux pr√©c√©dents. J'entend par la que l'exploration est moins importante et je n'ai pas retrouv√© les sursauts et les petits moments de stress des deux pr√©c√©dents. Le personnage est beaucoup plus mobile et le syst√®me de combat est plus proche d'un fps classique que les deux pr√©c√©dents volets. C'est ce qui m'a d√©√ßu dans ce jeu mais qui peu plaire a d'autres.

Ensuite l'histoire. J'ai attendu de finir le jeu pour le noter, car sans avoir vu la fin j'aurai surement mit 17 ou 18.
Mais ce final monumentale, ce suspens qui nous tient en haleine jusqu'au bout.. C'est du g√©nie. Rarement un jeu ne m'a autant passionn√© de part son histoire, c'est tellement bien amen√©, tellement bien fait avec un ptit clin d'oeil aux fan des pr√©c√©dents jeux. Franchement, bravo messieurs de chez Irrational Games. Vraiment.

Pour finir je ne peux que vous conseiller ce magnifique ce jeu.
amazing game 10/10 graphics are rlly good ! and the story too

I don't play story games because i usually get bored after 5 minutes. This one on the other hand is the best game i've ever had the pleasure to play. the atmosphere, story, twists and turns are just fantastic. 

I'd recommend it to any and every one.
Its just amazing, ill update my review after i finished all the dlcs sometime. 9/10

This is not just a game, this is as much an art as a book or a film or anything of that matter. It took me much longer than I first anticipated to finish, in fact I played it a bit, forgot about it for 4 years and then came around to finishing it. Took me some readup on plot to catch myself up to where I was but to be honest, the wait is worth it. I feel that I understood the story much more now 4 years later than I would've had 4 years ago. This game goes much more beneath the surface level of life and death and parallel universes, but it's more a discussion on philosophy and humanity.

After finally replaying the Bioshock series after playing the original Bioshock as a kid, I have to say that Bioshock infinite was probably my favorite. I felt connected to the characters and the whole plot of the story is amazing. I was worried I was not going to like it because of all the reviews saying the original Bioshock is better, but man let me tell you it did not let me down. You really do not have to have played the other Bioschocks to understand the game, unless you want to understand the references. If you can pick this game up while discounted it is really recommended by me.
so epic.
Oynamayan √ßok ≈üey kaybeder

Some people criticize Infinite because it's different from the original games. While they are different in tone and aesthetic, all 3 games are absolutely in their own right. Personally, infinite might actually be my favorite of all.
